properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: — (Required) The name of the record. The name is an owner name, that is, the name of the node to which this resource record pertains.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: — (Required) Domain zone, encapsulating any nested subdomains.

properties.name: recordType
properties.description: — (Required) The DNS record type.

properties.name: active
properties.description: — (Required,Boolean) Whether the record is active.

properties.name: ttl
properties.description: — (Required,Boolean) The TTL is a 32-bit signed integer that specifies the time interval that the resource record may be cached before the source of the information should be consulted again. Zero values are interpreted to mean that the RR can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached. Zero values can also be used for extremely volatile data.

properties.name: target
properties.description: — (Required) A domain name that specifies the canonical or primary name for the owner. The owner name is an alias.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: contract
properties.description: — (Required) The contract ID.

properties.name: group
properties.description: — (Required) The currently selected group ID.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: — (Required) Domain zone, encapsulating any nested subdomains.

properties.name: type
properties.description: — (Required) Whether the zone is primary or secondary.

properties.name: masters
properties.description: — (Required) The names or addresses of the customer’s nameservers from which the zone data should be retrieved.

properties.name: comment
properties.description: — (Required) A descriptive comment.

properties.name: sign_and_serve
properties.description: — (Required) Whether DNSSEC Sign&Serve is enabled.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: contract
properties.description: — (Required) The contract ID.

properties.name: group
properties.description: — (Required) The group ID.

properties.name: product
properties.description: — (Required) The product ID.

properties.name: edge_hostname
properties.description: — (Required) One or more edge hostnames (must be <= to the number of public hostnames).

properties.name: ipv4
properties.description: — (Optional) Whether the property supports IPv4 to origin. (Default: true).

properties.name: ipv6
properties.description: — (Optional) Whether the property supports IPv6 to origin. (Default: false).

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: — (Optional) The certificate enrollment ID.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: property-basics
properties.description: » Property Basics

properties.name: account
properties.description: — (Required) The account ID.

properties.name: contract
properties.description: — (Optional) The contract ID.

properties.name: group
properties.description: — (Optional) The group ID.

properties.name: product
properties.description: — (Optional) The product ID. (Default: prd_SPM for Ion)

properties.name: name
properties.description: — (Required) The property name.

properties.name: contact
properties.description: — (Required) One or more email addresses to inform about activation changes.

properties.name: hostnames
properties.description: — (Required) A map of public hostnames to edge hostnames (e.g. {"example.org" = "example.org.edgesuite.net"})

properties.name: is_secure
properties.description: — (Optional) Whether the property is a secure (Enhanced TLS) property or not.

properties.name: property-rules
properties.description: » Property Rules

properties.name: rules
properties.description: — (Required) A JSON encoded string of property rules (see: akamai_property_rules)

properties.name: rule_format
properties.description: — (Optional) The rule format to use (more).
In addition the specifying the rule tree in it's entirety, you can also set the default CP Code and Origin explicitly. This will override your JSON configuration.

properties.name: cp_code
properties.description: — (Required) The CP Code id or name to use (or create).

properties.name: list description
hostname
properties.description: — (Required) The origin hostname.

properties.name: port
properties.description: — (Optional) The origin port to connect to (default: 80).

properties.name: forward_hostname
properties.description: — (Optional) The value for the Hostname header sent to origin. (default: ORIGIN_HOSTNAME).

properties.name: cache_key_hostname
properties.description: — (Optional) The hostname uses for the cache key. (default: ORIGIN_HOSTNAME).

properties.name: compress
properties.description: — (Optional, boolean) Whether origin supports gzip compression (default: false).

properties.name: enable_true_client_ip
properties.description: — (Optional, boolean) Whether the X-True-Client-IP header should be sent to origin (default: false).
You can also define property manager variables. This will override your JSON configuration.

properties.name: variables
properties.description: — (Optional) A JSON encoded string of property manager variable definitions (see: akamai_property_variables)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: property
properties.description: — (Required) The property ID.

properties.name: version
properties.description: — (Optional) The version to activate. When unset it will activate the latest version of the property.

properties.name: network
properties.description: — (Optional) Akamai network to activate on. Allowed values staging or production (Default: staging).

properties.name: activate
properties.description: — (Optional, boolean) Whether to activate the property on the network. (Default: true).

properties.name: contact
properties.description: — (Required) One or more email addresses to inform about activation changes.
The following arguments are supported:
The variables block may contain many variable blocks which support the following arguments:

properties.name: name
properties.description: — (Required) The name of the variable.

properties.name: value
properties.description: — (Required) The default value to assign to the variable

properties.name: description
properties.description: — (Optional) A human-readable description

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: — (Optional) Whether to hide the variable when debugging requests

properties.name: sensitive
properties.description: — (Optional) Whether to obscure the value when debugging requests
